channel.title: Blog on qri
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on qri

item.title: How We Sped Up Unit Test Performance by 10x at Qri
item.description: Hi, I’m Dustin, and I work on Qri, helping build our tool for reusable, reproducable, reliable datasets on IPFS. My focus since joining earlier this year has been improving the stability and especially the performance of our application backend. A few months into working on this task, I was especially pained at how slow our entire unit test suite was taking to run - up to nearly 5 minutes on my machine.

item.title: Datasets Are Books, Not Houses
item.description: The world of linked data is built on shaky foundations that prevent a true data commons from emerging. The problem isnâ€™t with the data, but with the way data is linked. Specifically, the way links are addressed. An address is a uniform, shorthand way of referring to things. Geographic addresses are an obvious example. 1600 Pennsylvania Ave. is the address of the White House. 268 Elizabeth St. is the address of my childhood home.
